column4: what are you connecting to achieve? There may be a more graceful solution
i'm a system engineer in a company
i need to install 1 software in one linux machine. now the user went home
so i'm trying to enable the remote desktop through CLI, as i can access the remote machine using putty
if you install openssh-server on the system you can SSH in and use apt-get to install the packages you want...
that i know... i just want to view the desktop so that i can do it through gui
i'm not that familiar with linux commands
if its not enabled now, you will need to physically attend the system
ok.. so there is no command to enable remote desktop? :(
not without knowing where the VNC stuff is
i googled and found out one command ... "gconftool-2"
Newer releases don't use gconftool-2 now
bt its not working for me...
you will need to attend the ssytem. I would put openssh-server on all systems so you can install apps and such remotely
